meanings.definition: to throw or pass (a ball) with a downward motion from above the shoulder.
meanings.sent1: He overhands the ball to his teammate during the game.
meanings.sent2: She always overhands the ball when playing volleyball.
meanings.sent3: The monkey overhands the banana to the other side of the cage.
meanings.sent4: The magician overhands the playing cards with precision and flair.
meanings.sent5: The coach demonstrated how to overhands the ball for better accuracy.

meanings.definition: situated or occurring above the hands.
meanings.sent1: The overhands shelf was too high for the child to reach.
meanings.sent2: The painting hung on the overhands beam in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The overhands light fixture made the room look brighter.
meanings.sent4: The overhands branches of the tree provided shade on hot days.
meanings.sent5: The overhands clock was difficult to read from the bed.
